Description: Flint arrow-head, concave or ‘hollow’-based with incurving barbs, bifacially worked.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p.7; pl. xxvi.1; xxix.6)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
